title: (x) "Golf Club" script in Jade Palace Golf Club logo - Bodoni Italic {Mike Y}
content:
Hello, could anybody tell me what this font is, or any similar ones?  
I’m trying to find exact fonts for both main type, Jade Palace and sub type, Golf Club.  
The main type seems to be EF Ballantines Script Light, but I don’t see it exactly overlaping. And as far as the sub type goes, I have no idea what exactly the font is used. Can anyone please identify them?  
Your help would be highly appreciated. Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906191107im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/jpgc_3519.jpg)

 [‹ (x) Monospaced sans screenfont on DV Cam interface - similar to Monospace 821 {Mike Y}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906191107/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45534 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) "Thirsty for intimacy" DIN-style tech sans caps - Pill Gothic {Curtis S} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906191107/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45358 "Go to next forum topic")
author: sangwooksohn

comments.content:
You’re right about it being [Ballantines Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906191107/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/ballantines-script/), (a.k.a. Goddess) although maybe a heavier weight than light. “Golf Club” looks like an Italic of one of the Bodonis. I’ll try to see if I can narrow it down.

- Mike Yanega

[ITC Bodoni Twelve](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906191107/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-bodoni-twelve/) Italic is pretty close (at least it has the C with no lower serif), but it looks like the letters were slanted more to match the script slant, and their tracking was tightened to cram the letters closer together.

- Mike Yanega
